questions.question: Alexander the Great ……………………. every opponent between Greece and India.
He ………………………… all competition in the elections.
questions.description: You beat the person you are playing or fighting against.

questions.question: They ………………………. him to within an inch of his life.
questions.description: The past tense of beat is beat.

questions.question: The sea gull ………………………. its wings against the air.
He …………………….. me at poker the other day.
questions.description: You beat the person you are playing or fighting against.

questions.question: India ……………………. the championship ………………………….. Australia in the final.
questions.description: You win an argument, game or battle and you beat the person you are playing or fighting against.

questions.question: The actor ………………………… an award for his role in the film.
questions.description: Win is the past tense of won.

questions.question: Opponents of the project must be ………………………… over.
questions.description: The past participle form of the verb is used after must be.

questions.question: Four more ……………………… and we will clinch the championship.
questions.description: When win is used as a noun, it has the plural form - wins.

questions.question: She was upset because she …………………………. the game.
questions.description: When you lose the game, you are beaten by your opponent.
